channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Roadside has white material running down it, covering yellow lines, 1st July
item.description:
Could be something like diluted cement or render that a builder has spilt into the road, and it has hardened at the road edge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2b Hale's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New road subsidence dangerous!, 1st July
item.description:
Very dangerous subsidence and if a large vehicle/lorry is coming towards you, you are forced onto the centre of the road ,and potholes all around old village Bishopscleeve
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): New Road, Cleeve Hill

item.title: 10x10, 1st July
item.description:
This pothole is not too deep but has been reported before as the new road surface is breaking up due a very large puddle in this area during rain helping to increase its size.A repair now will prevent any further damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 71 New Barn Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Overgrown vegetation making footpath unusable, 30th June
item.description:
The hedge / greenery on this whole corner is so overgrown that in places the footpath cannot be used & last night while on way to Brownies, daughter & I had to step off the pavement into the road. As it is on a corner it is difficult to see past the vegetation to see oncoming traffic too. Very dangerous. A pram / buggy / wheelchair could not negotiate this path at the moment. Some of the vegetation are stinging nettles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Priory Lodge School Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown grass, 30th June
item.description:
On the approach for Zoons Court roundabout coming from the C&G roundabout (A417 heading out of Gloucester) the grass is so overgrown that I can’t see safely to enter the roundabout. The roundabout and the other approach (from Cirencester to Gloucester) have been cut, but the other approaches haven’t and it’s extremely dangerous. I have a normal size car, not lowered which would hamper my vision. This roundabout is quite dangerous at the best of times, now it’s lethal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More abandoned roadworks signs, 29th June
item.description:
2 roadworks signs, left abandoned on side of road for weeks, with no roadworks being done. Outside numbers 174 and 180 Gloucester Road. Need to be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 184 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree branches limiting pedestrian access to pavement., 29th June
item.description:
Tree needs a trim…?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 92 Suffolk Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Loose manhole cover making loud noise when driven over, 29th June
item.description:
There is an issue with this manhole cover, not sure if loose or just an exposed edge. Cars which drive over cause two loud bangs which total in the hundreds per day. Can be disruptive to sleep at night. It’s located on ryeworth road not far from junction with hambrook st

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 67 Ryeworth Road, Ryeworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines faded and vans and cars park on the roundabout which is an offence ,, 28th June
item.description:
Vans and cars park on ten roundabout illegally and get way with it because there are no double yellow lines as faded. Hoe er still against traffic act to park on a roundabout, causes issues with delivery vehicles to the comunitity centre .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 78 Springbank Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing stop tap cover, 28th June
item.description:
The metal cover of this tap on the pavement is missing. This leaves a very deep hole that someone could step into. Dangerous! it may be a water stop cock hole. Severn Trent?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Former Cotswold Bmw Site Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Growing crack/pothole, 28th June
item.description:
You have told me this has been inspected and there's no problem! This has deteriorated since I first reported it last week. It's a rack/hole in the surface which is expanding and becoming more dangerous by the day. It is in a parking bay so cars are constantly going over it or parked over it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Montpellier Grove, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge overgrowing footpath in Manor Road, 27th June
item.description:
The hedge alongside Manor Road has grown over the footpath. The footpath is alongside a 60mph length of road. The reduced width is dangerous to pedestrians who are unable to pass each other without one person having to step off the pavement and into a heavily trafficked road. A lady has reported that she had to walk in single file with an 8 year old child.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Mackenzie Way, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet
